Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum produced a game-high 33 points against the Brooklyn Nets.
Sam Hauser made a crucial shot after missing eight earlier shots.
Al Horford made a massive tie-breaking triple in overtime that gave Boston the lead for good.
Pre-Game Insights: Jayson Tatum said, 'We always believe the next one is going in because he’s such a proven shooter and works really hard at his craft.'
Joe Mazzulla said, 'All of his teammates were empowering him to keep shooting.'
Post-Match Reflections: Jayson Tatum said, 'It’s not time to panic when things aren’t going great … Sometimes you’re going to make shots. Sometimes you’re going to miss them. But we’ve still got to play the way that we believe to be the right way to play.'
Al Horford said, 'We know the type of shooters that we have, and those are shots that we have to take. We had a lot of good looks, and you just have to take them and trust in your process.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics overcame a season-low 26.4 percent shooting from deep to win the game.
The team struggled to shoot the 3-ball throughout the game, but made their shots when it mattered most.
Others: The game went into overtime with the Celtics trailing 91-89 with a little more than two minutes remaining in regulation.
Jayson Tatum had a 33-point, nine-rebound, six-assist, two-block, one-steal performance.
